source.e3ebe682:
#code copy https://iandzy.com/histograms-cumulative-distribution/
def plot_cdf(data, bin_size,title=None, xlabel=None):

    counts, bin_edges = np.histogram (data, bins=bin_size, normed=True)
    cdf = np.cumsum(counts)
    
    sns.set_style("whitegrid")
    plt.figure(figsize=(18,13))
    plt.plot (bin_edges[1:], cdf/cdf[-1])
    plt.ylabel('CDF')
    
    if title:
        plt.title(title)
    if xlabel:
        plt.xlabel(xlabel)
    plt.show()

*__Conclusion__* - In the Boxplot Graph ,We plotted the *__home_ownership__* VS *__Loan Amount__* - In the boxplot ,it is Summary of Five number Result :- - In the Boxplot , We have (“minimum”, first quartile (Q1), median, Third quartile (Q3), and “maximum ) - In our Plot :

*__RENT__*
- Minimum:-Above the 0 - First Quartile(25%):-Its means that 25% of RENT of loan amount is below 5000 - Median(50%):-Its means that 50% of RENT of loan amount about 75000 - Third Quartile(75%):-Its means that 75 % of RENT of loan amount about 14000 - Maximum(100) :Its means that maximum amount is 27000 - In *__RENT__* ,there is lots of outlier point ,outlier from onwards *__27000__* *__OWN__* - Mininmum:-above zero - First Quartile(25%):-Its means that 25% of OWN of loan amount is below 5000 - Median(50%):-Its means that 50% of OWN of loan amount about 75000 - Third Quartile(75%):-Its means that 75 % of OWN of loan amount about above 14000 - Maximum(100) :Its means that maximum amount is 25000 *__MORTAGE__* - Mininmum:-above zero - First Quartile(25%):-Its means that 25% of OWN of loan amount is below 75000 - Median(50%):-Its means that 50% of OWN of loan amount about 11000 - Third Quartile(75%):-Its means that 75 % of OWN of loan amount about above 16000 - Maximum(100) :Its means that maximum amount is 30000 *__OTHER__* - Mininmum:-above zero - First Quartile(25%):-Its means that 25% of OWN of loan amount is below 6000 - Median(50%):-Its means that 50% of OWN of loan amount about 10000 - Third Quartile(75%):-Its means that 75 % of OWN of loan amount about above 15000 - Maximum(100) :Its means that maximum amount is 25000 *__Summary__* - More loan Amout , Mortage, customer are more number * NONE , Have less in very things from all these category

source.4aee59b0:
*__violin plot__* - Its mixture of boxplot and Density Estimate - Its Give about Distribution of Data through the Desnsity Estimation - Its Contains , Boxplot internally and Side by Side its Conations the mirrored Image of Density Estimate - The advantage of a violin plot is that it can show nuances in the distribution that aren’t perceptible in a boxplot. *__Conclusion__*:- - *__36 months__* * In this plot , Most of loan Amount is Amount 5000 * Most of loan Amount is less than 5000 * As the loan Amount Increase the , Less Number of borrower seen in 36 months terms * Above the 5000, Fewer Customer are Seen * In the 30 months,Most of customers lies between 0 % to 75 %
- *__60 months__* * In this plot , Most of loan Amount is Amount 15000 * Most of loan Amount is less than 5000 * As the loan Amount Increase the , Less Number of borrower seen in 60 months terms * Above the 15000, Fewer Customer are Seen
* In the 60 months ,We Seen that fewer amount of and bigger amount of Customer are both * In the 60 months , Most of Customer lies between 25% to 75 %

*__conclusion__*
- Here is Fully Paid customer is more then Charged off and Current 
- Fully Paid :Those cutomer who paid all payment(principle and interest amoutn both)
- Charged off :those customer who did not pay the principle amoutn + interest amount 
- Current :- Those customer ,who are still  paying the installment 
- Fully Paid Customer :82.96 %
- Charged Off : 14.16 %
- Current :2.87%
